title: Serial Part Typizations
description: A serialized part is an instantiation of a (design-) part, where the particular instantiation can be uniquely identified by means of a serial numbers or a similar identifier (e.g. VAN) or a combination of multiple identifiers (e.g. combination of manufacturer, date and number)

uuid.title: UUID URN
uuid.description: The fully anonymous Catena-X ID of the serialized part, valid for the Catena-X dataspace. The provided regular expression ensures that the UUID is composed of five groups of characters separated by hyphens, in the form 8-4-4-4-12 for a total of 36 characters (32 hexadecimal characters and 4 hyphens), optionally prefixed by 'urn:uuid:' to make it an IRI.

part_instance_id.title: Part Instance ID
part_instance_id.description: The serial number of the serialized part from the manufacturer. We assume here that the customer does not have or create its own serial number for a part, but just used the manufacturer's serial number.

manufacturing_date.title: Manufacturing Date
manufacturing_date.description: Timestamp of the manufacturing date as the final step in production process (e.g. final quality check, ready-for-shipment event)

manufacturing_country.title: Manufacturing Country
manufacturing_country.description: Country code where the part was manufactured

manufacturer_part_id.title: Manufacturer Part ID
manufacturer_part_id.description: Part ID as assigned by the manufacturer of the part. The Part ID identifies the part (as designed) in the manufacturer`s dataspace. The Part ID does not reference a specific instance of a part and thus should not be confused with the serial number.

customer_part_id.title: Customer Part ID
customer_part_id.description: Part ID as assigned by the manufacturer of the part. The Part ID identifies the part (as designed) in the customer`s dataspace. The Part ID does not reference a specific instance of a part and thus should not be confused with the serial number.

classification.title: Classification
classification.description: The classification of the part type according to STEP standard definition.

name_at_manufacturer.title: Name At Manufacturer
name_at_manufacturer.description: Name of the part as assigned by the manufacturer

name_at_customer.title: Name At Customer
name_at_customer.description: Name of the part as assigned by the customer

optional_identifier_key.title: Optional Identifier Key
optional_identifier_key.description: The key of a local identifier.
